summary: Browser-based 3D plane/flight simulation app that renders a procedurally generated world (random terrain and buildings) as the surrounding environment while flying (no Google Maps dependency).
architectural_notes: Surrounding environment will be generated procedurally (random terrain + buildings) rather than using Google Maps imagery/data.

existing_features.title: Implement a browser-based 3D plane flight simulation scene (React Three Fiber/Three.js) with basic flight controls (pitch, roll, yaw, throttle) and a third-person chase camera that follows the aircraft.
Integrate Google Maps imagery/data to render the surrounding environment during flight, so the visible ground/terrain context updates as the plane moves across latitude/longitude.
Add an on-screen flight HUD displaying at minimum: airspeed (or simulated speed), altitude, heading, throttle percentage, and current lat/long; HUD must update in real time while flying.
Provide an in-app start/reset flow: a start screen (or overlay) with brief control instructions, and a reset action that returns the aircraft to an initial spawn position and default speed/altitude.
Apply a coherent visual theme across the app (typography, color palette, spacing, panels) suitable for an aviation simulator UI; avoid a blue/purple-dominant palette.
Add generated static image assets (icons) for the HUD (e.g., compass/heading indicator and throttle icon) and render them from frontend/public/assets/generated (not via the backend).
Remove the Google Maps dependency and configuration gating so the simulator runs without requiring VITE_GOOGLE_MAPS_API_KEY.
Replace the map-textured ground implementation with a procedurally generated terrain surface that is generated locally and updates as the aircraft moves.
Add procedurally generated buildings/structures placed on the terrain, with density/placement varying across the world, and ensure they update/stream consistently as the aircraft moves.

Ensure the procedural world generation is deterministic for a given seed and integrate it with the sim reset flow (reset returns the aircraft to spawn and the world generation behavior is consistent and predictable).

new_feature_requests.summary: Implement a 3D plane/flight simulation in the browser
Replace Google Maps surroundings with procedurally generated random terrain and buildings that update as the plane moves

projectName: 3D plane simulation with Google Maps surroundings
